I recently purchased the Chefman 4 QT Air Fryer, and it's been a revelation for my daily cooking routine! Right off the bat, the size is perfect for my countertop, and the sleek design fits nicely with my other kitchen appliances.

The "Hi-Fry Technology" that Chefman touts definitely lives up to the hype. It heats up quickly and maintains a consistent temperature throughout the cooking process, which is crucial for achieving that perfect, crispy texture without the excess oil. I've tried everything from french fries and chicken wings to roasted vegetables, and all have come out deliciously crispy and evenly cooked.

One of my favorite features is how easy it is to clean. The basket is non-stick, so a quick rinse and occasional gentle scrub is all it takes. The compact size doesn't mean a compromise on capacity either; it comfortably cooks enough food for a family of four.

Another great point is how it simplifies cooking. The interface is user-friendly with straightforward controls and preset options that take the guesswork out of cooking times and temperatures. It's perfect for quick meals, especially on busy weeknights when time is of the essence.

The only slight downside is that it can be a bit noisy while operating, but considering the speed and quality of cooking, it's a minor inconvenience.

Overall, the Chefman 4 QT Air Fryer has been an excellent addition to my kitchen. It's efficient, easy to use, and produces great results with little to no oil. If you're looking for a healthier alternative to traditional frying that doesn't sacrifice taste or convenience, this air fryer is definitely worth considering!

I have used the quick-crisp feature- it made my breaded nuggets have the extra crunch that you expect from a regular fryer.

THE BASICS: It's a 6 quart capacity air fryer with touchscreen controls.

WORTHY WINS: It's easy to understand and operate, and it cooks crisp & evenly (french fries, so far!). It also has a really helpful feature that reminds you to shake the basket half way through the cook cycle.

MISSED OPPORTUNITIES: That I didn't have an air fryer until now! People have been talking about these for like 3 years already. I'm a little late to the festivities, but I'm glad it's the Chefman's party I'm attending!

FINAL GRADE: A+

PARTING THOUGHTS: I can't wait to try cooking more, different types of "fried" foods in this!

A few things to point out. The instructions recommend unplugging the unit when it's not in use. This is actually fairly sound advice for any appliance as there is a thing in electronics called "vampire energy" or "phantom energy". They say that unused electronics in standby mode "DVD players, stereos, etc." can account for up to 20% in a home electricity bill.

Another thing that other reviewers have pointed out are the little rubber pieces on the grill insert. They do indeed come off. I'd recommend hand washing the grill and just keeping in mind not to push off the rubber pieces.

As for the grill itself, I've read others complaining about not knowing how to insert it. This is actually understandable as it's a pretty tight fit the first time due to the shape of the design. The way I ended up remembering is by placing the quart bucket with the handle facing directly towards me (or directly away). From this position the grill goes in with the large center gaps looking like a figure 8. You'll probably have to force it in a bit the first time but it gets easier after you do some cooking with it. I'm guessing this is due to the rubber pieces shrinking ever so slightly from the heat exposure.
